title.narrative: Drought response: Multi sectoral and integrated response to hard to reach and most vulnerable people in Helmand, Ghor and Badghis aiming to mitigate displacement and reduce negative coping strategies

description.narrative:
This project design is both multi sectoral (Nutrition, WASH and Protection) and integrated design. This design aims to build on past and current actions across those same sectors as well as Emergency response, by implementing sectoral responses and integrated responses not yet present in areas where other sectors are already reaching people. While past and current actions outside of this proposal were/are not drought responses, they have morphed in to drought response in that these needs have become priorities for all beneficiaries in those provinces in particular with limited developmental gains or systems of resilience to environmental risk factors, most notably drought at this time. This project aims to reach people prior to displacement as a priority, and support displaced groups made more vulnerable by drought and associated reduced resources. More explicitly, in Helmand: ACF currently reaches beneficiaries in Nutrition and essential care practices with current partner AYSO, in remote areas, therefore under this project proposal this partnership and associated capacity building is expanded to include mainstreamed CPiE, GBViE, water kit distributions. In compliment, with the aim of reaching people at their place of origin, water points for communities, child protection centers, case management of child protection and continuation of integrated GBV will be applied to strongly mitigate any development gains being lost as well as displacement. In Ghor Similarly, in Ghor, ACF is already a very active stakeholder and partner with BPHS implementer in Nutrition and GBV therefore, an expanded partnership with CHA will support the establishment of child friendly safe spaces/breastfeeding corners across 3 districts. Rehabilitation of construction of water points, and where competition for water access between animals and humans is high, ACF will work with communities to facilitate priorities for human use and animal use appropriately. Badghis: Through implementing partner, AYSO, ACF will transfer with AYSO the capacity building from Helmand to Badghis in order to conduct outreach services through mobile Nutrition clinics including integrated PSS officers to reach people at their place of origin, complimented by training in Health facilities on PSS and IMAM and IYCF-E.
In mitigating the following risks:
Maintained access in hard to reach areas across security impacted and winter impacted areas Maintained good community access through close collaboration of communities and reaching through their support, and Access to visit and monitor quality of service delivery and capacity building of partners in remote locations
A comprehensive security access plan (see sections below) will be implemented, in coordination with a surveillance plan on nutritional needs to circulate findings to all Nutrition stakeholders.
